definition: to exist in name only/empty shell/useless (idiom)
emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display

sentences.english: Even the doors that were not locked were of no use to the workers.
sentences.chinese: 即使那些没有上锁的门对工人们来说也形同虚设。

sentences.english: Discussions about meeting anti-poverty and development goals went virtually ignored.
sentences.chinese: 有关实现脱贫和发展目标等议题的讨论几乎形同虚设。

sentences.english: However, not applied, all high-end devices exist in name only.
sentences.chinese: 然而，没有应用，所有的高档设备都形同虚设。

sentences.english: This organization is but a empty shell.
There are sanctions in place against Iran at present but they have been largely ineffective.
sentences.chinese: 目前仍有针对伊朗的制裁，但这些措施已形同虚设。

sentences.english: The public transportation is virtually non-existence. And you should never rely on it.
sentences.chinese: 公共交通形同虚设，你不能依赖它。

sentences.english: Organisations become more Ruritanian.The job market becomes more opaque.
sentences.chinese: 组织结构形同虚设，就业市场晦暗不明。

definition: the name remains, but the reality is gone (idiom)
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
not to do one's best/not to exert oneself
unable to move a single step (idiom)/to be in an (extremely) difficult situation
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
lit. has a name but no reality (idiom); exists only in name/nominal
the will is there, but not the strength (idiom)/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
pinyin: xin1 you3 yu2 er2 li4 bu4 zu2

definition: lit. like a sheet of loose sand/fig. unable to cooperate (idiom)
